Ah, paragraph 2 should refer to the code Y flag: Code Y now indicates “I am dragging my anchor”
Sorry for the confusion.

author: Jean-Pierre Declemy
content:
Code flag Y (red and yellow diagonal stripes) historically was hoisted by ships with infectious diseases on board, ships that were healthy and requested free pratique flew the all yellow Q flag.
Nowadays because there are so few health problems code Z is used for “I require a tug” and the Q flag is used to invite customs and excise to rummage your vessel before giving you “free pratique”
